column4: hello I'm trying to compile and install x264 or h264 whatever you want to call it. When I try to do it I get this error: /usr/bin/ld: cannot open output file x264: Is a directory
collect2: ld returned 1 exit status
make: *** [x264] Error 1
So what do I do now?
I can't find the x264 directory it's talking about. I don't know where it is.
anyone?
Mark-I saw that
there is no need to compile it
yes there is. KDENLIVE won't use it unless you compile it yourself
which version? works here for me
According to everywhere on the internet the problem lies with a legal problem that Ubuntu can't put certain things in the package they have for h264
you should explain what you are trying to do first of all
I can't render h264 no matter what I do. The guy here had the same problem. He had to do this: http://ubuntuforums.org/showthread.php?t=1117283
!br | Guest37836
that's what I'm trying to do
for Ubuntu 9.10
do what?
the instructions at that link
according to every forum I've found following those instructions is my only way to make KDENLIVE do what I want. I've got every codec able to render except h264
autoconf-archive, texlive-binaries jacobian
do you understand yet?
